NAME: Aberrant behavior
DEFINITION: Behavior that is unusual and not associated with known functional context, most often seen among captive animals and relatively rare in the wild

NAME: Abnormal ingestion
DEFINITION: The consumption of a substance outside of the known diet that has been normally recorded in the wild.

NAME: Over-grooming-plucking
DEFINITION: The manipulation of the animal's own fur, feathers, etc. with its hands, beak, etc. that leads to the excessive removal of the fur, feathers, or skin

NAME: Self-injurious behavior
DEFINITION: Behavior that physically wounds the actor.

NAME: Stereotypic movement
DEFINITION: Any highly repetitive behavior, where the repetition is unusual, difficult to disrupt, and neither the behavior nor repetition serve an obvious function

NAME: Agonism
DEFINITION: Behavior that occurs in the context of conflict or as a result of conflict or a direct precursor to conflic

NAME: Agonistic alarm
DEFINITION: Behavior signalling awareness of and or fear of danger, triggered by agonistic actions or postures of a conspecific rather than a predator

NAME: Agonistic buffering
DEFINITION: Carrying or manipulation of infants or equivalent items to reduce chances of aggression on carrier by other animals

NAME: Agonistic chase
DEFINITION: Sudden and rapid following of one animal by another during an agonistic conflict

NAME: Appeasement
DEFINITION: Behavior that can inhibit intraspecific attack or aggressive behavior by means other than intimidation2 or flight 3

NAME: Assessment
DEFINITION: A behavior on the part of one individual associated with evaluating the fighting ability or correlates of fighting ability of a potential opponent

NAME: Coercion
DEFINITION: Behavior involving force or threat by an actor that modifies the behavior of another animal to the actor's benefit

NAME: Contact aggression
DEFINITION: Agonistic behavior involving direct physical contact including (but not limited to) biting, kicking, grabbing

NAME: Displacement
DEFINITION: Behavior of one individual that spatially supplants another individual; the connotation is that the displaced individual is giving way to the supplanting individual

NAME: Escalation
DEFINITION: Behavioral change from a lower intensity to a higher intensity form of directed agonistic behavior

NAME: Exclusion
DEFINITION: Behavior that serves to prevent access of an animal to a group, resource or location

NAME: Injure
DEFINITION: Behavior in which one animal causes physical damage to another

NAME: Kill
DEFINITION: Behavior in which one animal causes the death of another

NAME: Retreat
DEFINITION: Behavior by which an animal removes itself spatially from an agonistic encounter in which it is not the winner

NAME: Submission
DEFINITION: Any behavior that tends to prevent further or future attack, often by signalling a willingness to yield or surrender

NAME: Threat
DEFINITION: Behavior that signifies hostility, may intimidate or repel an opponent and predicts an increased probability of attack

NAME: Triumph
DEFINITION: Display behavior by the winner of a prior agonistic contest

NAME: Antipredation
DEFINITION: Behavior that decreases an organism's probability of being preyed on.

NAME: Aposematism
DEFINITION: Conspicuous postures or signals (often involving coloration) that potential predators learn to associate with strong defense mechanisms of performer

NAME: Attack predator
DEFINITION: Perform physically violent acts toward a presumed predator

NAME: Bluff
DEFINITION: Behavior, typically threat behavior in a situation likely to lead to combat, that overrepresents the combat ability or intentions of the actor

NAME: Create refuge
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with construction of a structure or shelter in which actor can benefit from reduced predation risk and or environmental stress

NAME: Decoy-misdirection
DEFINITION: Behavior directed towards presumed predators to redirect their attention away from a location of importance to the performer

NAME: Defense deployment
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with activating visual, auditory or chemical deterrents to predation including, but not limited to, flashing eye spots (visual) or expulsion of noxious liquid (chemical)

NAME: Detection notification
DEFINITION: Postures or signals that can communicate to predator that it has been detected by performer

NAME: Display condition to predator
DEFINITION: Performance of behaviors that demonstrate physical condition of performer to a detected predator

NAME: Distress signalling
DEFINITION: Signal emitted by an animal trapped or captured by a presumed predator

NAME: Enhance crypsis
DEFINITION: Behavior that reduces detectability of performer against background

NAME: Feign death
DEFINITION: The act of maintaining tonic immobility and reducing other evidence of being alive in the presence of a predator

NAME: Flee
DEFINITION: The act of departing the current location of predator, typically rapidly

NAME: Inspect predator
DEFINITION: The act of orienting conspicuously towards and-or approaching a detected predator without attacking or interacting with it

NAME: Jamming
DEFINITION: Emission of signals in such a way as to prevent effective use of signals emitted by other parties

NAME: Mimicry enhancement
DEFINITION: Behavior that increases similarity of actor to aposematic animals, plants, or inanimate objects that are undesirable as food to the predators of actor

NAME: Mobbing
DEFINITION: Harassment of and-or attack of a presumed predator or intruder by multiple individuals at once

NAME: Occupy refuge
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with taking a position in a constructed or existing structure that provides reduced predator and or environmental risk

NAME: Promote confusion
DEFINITION: Erratic movements or similar behaviors that would confuse a predator

NAME: Reduce activity
DEFINITION: The act of halting or diminution of activity to minimize detection by predator

NAME: Threaten predator
DEFINITION: Behavior directed at a predator that signifies hostility and predicts an increased probability of attack

NAME: Vigilance
DEFINITION: Surveillance for presence or approach of predators

NAME: Warn other prey
DEFINITION: Postures or signals that alert other animals to presence or approach of a predator

NAME: Maintenance
DEFINITION: Behaviors designed to maintain current condition or promote internally stimulated shifts between conditions

NAME: Autohygiene
DEFINITION: Self-cleaning, rearranging of body surface coverings, application of secretions or ambient materials related functionally to maintaining the body surface

NAME: Medication
DEFINITION: Consumption or use of substances with presumed curative or medicinal value

NAME: Molting-faciliating behavior
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with removal of old body covering that is replaced through prior or subsequent growth with new one; replacement may or may not involve slight changes in body size and or structure

NAME: Refuge creation and maintenance
DEFINITION: Construction or modification of area or structure that provides safety from potential predators

NAME: Respiratory ventiliation
DEFINITION: Behavior that results in replacement of respiratory medium at relevant absorbent surfaces

NAME: Thermoregulation behavior
DEFINITION: Behavior that facilitates maintenance of optimal body temperatures

NAME: Cooling
DEFINITION: Behavior that serves to reduce body temperature, for instance, moving to shade or panting

NAME: Sunning-basking
DEFINITION: Exposure of body to sunlight, either by modification of body posture, by movement to specific areas or both

NAME: Migration
DEFINITION: Temporally regular movement from one place to another, most commonly seasonal

NAME: Nutrient acquisition
DEFINITION: Behavior related to acquisition and utilization of external food resources

NAME: Aiding digestion
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with consumption of specific compounds that facilitate processing of food items

NAME: Capturing
DEFINITION: Suite of behaviors involved in securing a prey item once it has been located

NAME: Capture prey
DEFINITION: Behavior that result in ending flight of prey with successful predation

NAME: Chase prey
DEFINITION: Active pursuit of fleeing prey

NAME: Construct capture device
DEFINITION: Building of a trap, web, net, or other structure to help ensnare potential food items

NAME: Flush prey
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with a predator forcing potential prey to emerge from cover

NAME: Stalk prey
DEFINITION: Behavior of approaching prey in manner designed to avoid early detection by prey

NAME: Dealing with toxins
DEFINITION: Behaviors associated with the processes of identification, avoidance, or neutralization of toxic substances in food

NAME: Food storage
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with locating one or many food items in particular places for later use and for protection from competition

NAME: Ingest
DEFINITION: The act of bringing an object or substance into the body by swallowing, surrounding or absorbing it

NAME: Nutrient locating
DEFINITION: Behaviors associated with  the detection of new food resources

NAME: Follow trail to resource
DEFINITION: Locomotion to a food resource guided by visual or olfactory cues created along a route by a prior finder and-or user of that resource

NAME: Food exposure
DEFINITION: Behavior that functions to reveal a hidden food resource, such as digging, cracking, or breaking

NAME: Recovery from cache
DEFINITION: The act of removing a food resource from a location where it was previously stored or from previously-stored supply of food

NAME: Nutrient preparation
DEFINITION: Behavior that precedes and facilitates attaining food

NAME: Food extraction
DEFINITION: Removal of food items from location by use of appendage or tool

NAME: Processing
DEFINITION: Behaviors that prepare food for consumption, such as nut-cracking or peeling

NAME: Suitability assessment
DEFINITION: Sensory evaluation of a resource, (usually using olfaction or taste), for appropriateness of subsequent usage

NAME: Resource advertisement
DEFINITION: Postures or signals directed at other animals to indicate the presence, and in some cases, the location, quantity, and quality, of a resource

NAME: Social acquisition of food
DEFINITION: Behaviors associated with obtaining food that has been procured by other conspecifics or heterospecifics

NAME: Beg food
DEFINITION: Perform behaviors that may induce one or more other animals to share food with the performer

NAME: Scrounge
DEFINITION: Uninvited taking of food from another animal

NAME: Scavenge
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with locating and acquiring food that has been killed or procured by another animal

NAME: Share food
DEFINITION: Behavior in which animals allow other animals to utilize a resource they currently control

NAME: Play
DEFINITION: A very broad category including the partial or complete performance of adult functional behaviors in non-functional contexts, as well as interactive behaviors peculiar to immature animals

NAME: Motor play
DEFINITION: Undirected behavior involving exercise and coordination, and often associated with repetition and 'practice' of adult behavior patterns in a non-functional context

NAME: Object play
DEFINITION: Solitary play in which individual interacts with an inanimate object, food item or live prey

NAME: Social play
DEFINITION: Play involving 2 or more conspecifics that are actively interacting.

NAME: Reproduction
DEFINITION: Behavior directly related to the production of offspring

NAME: Breeding site selection
DEFINITION: Action resulting in establishment or use of one locale for reproductive activity

NAME: Courtship
DEFINITION: Display, feeding, and other activities used to persuade or induce another individual to mate with the animal performing the behavior; broadly encompasses precopulatory, pair-forming and pair-bonding behaviors

NAME: Courtship begging
DEFINITION: Solicitation of food provisioning by a potential mate

NAME: Courtship feeding
DEFINITION: Provisioning of food to a potential mate

NAME: Mating appeasement
DEFINITION: Behavior that serves to demonstrate non-aggressive intent by one member of a courting or potentially mating pair to the other

NAME: Mating solicitation
DEFINITION: Performance of a behavior that indicates the performer's willingness to mate or bond

NAME: Sexual cannibalism
DEFINITION: Consumption of one member of a mating pair, usually the male, by the other member, usually after the mating

NAME: Gamete release function
DEFINITION: Behavior that facilitates gamete release or transfer of gametes

NAME: Facililtate oviposition
DEFINITION: Deposition of eggs either into the medium, or onto a substrate

NAME: Insemination-copulation
DEFINITION: Male's insertion of sperm-transfer organ into the body of the female

NAME: Mating amplexus
DEFINITION: The clasping of the female by a male, before and-or during the release of gametes, and ensuring close proximity of released gametes

NAME: Spawning
DEFINITION: Release of gametes of one or both sexes into the ambient medium

NAME: Spermatophore deposition
DEFINITION: Behavior involved in the deposition of spermatophore either on substrate or in body of female

NAME: Interference
DEFINITION: Behavior by members of one sex that disrupt or inhibit the completion of courtship or mating activities by one or more members of the same sex

NAME: Insert genital plug
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with deposition of material by male following ejaculation to block access to female's reproductive tract during her future matings

NAME: Sperm competition behavior
DEFINITION: Any behavior by a male or his gametes that increases the probability that eggs will be fertilized by his own sperm

NAME: Sperm scraping
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with the use of specialized male organs to remove sperm already deposited in female's reproductive tract

NAME: Mate choosing
DEFINITION: Behaviors associated with selecting of a member of the opposite sex for mating

NAME: Mate sampling
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with gaining information on presence, availability and suitability of potential mates,  including sensory evaluation of medium to detect presence of possible mates as well as interactions with encountered individuals specifically to determine mate suitability

NAME: Reproductive status assessment
DEFINITION: Behaviors associated with assessment of cues and signals from an encountered individual to determine its reproductive condition

NAME: Mate finding
DEFINITION: Behavior invoved in the active search for possible mates

NAME: Hunt for mate
DEFINITION: Behavior involved in the active searching for potential mate

NAME: Mate attraction behavior
DEFINITION: Advertisement of availability, quality, condition, or some other property related to breeding

NAME: Broadcast advertisement
DEFINITION: Signal or behavior that reveals presence of the signaller and is directed to multiple receivers rather than limited to particular receivers

NAME: Build display structure
DEFINITION: Creation of or modification of a structure or area that is used in attraction of mates

NAME: Nest relief
DEFINITION: The act of taking over activities involved in the care of eggs or offspring, as one nest attendant replaces another

NAME: Nest-egg sac creation
DEFINITION: Building of nest, burrow or safe container for offspring (eggs or young)

NAME: Offspring care
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with protection, or assisting growth and development of offspring

NAME: Feeding young
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with provision of food, water, or other nutrients to offspring

NAME: Hatching or birth faciliation
DEFINITION: Behavior that expedites or aids in the birth or hatching process

NAME: Hygiene
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with cleaning of offspring (eggs, young), removal of ectoparasites, or removal of wastes from vicinity of offspring

NAME: Microclimate regulation
DEFINITION: Behavior designed to regulate the microclimate around offspring

NAME: Humidity regulation
DEFINITION: Behavior that serves to regulate the humidity around offspring

NAME: Thermoregulation
DEFINITION: Behavior that serves to regulate the temperature around offspring

NAME: Offspring expulsion
DEFINITION: Harassment or other behavior that serves to evict recent offspring from parental group, territory, nest, or other prior residence of offspring

NAME: Offspring instruction behavior
DEFINITION: Any behavior apparently designed to accelerate learning of necessary behaviors by offspring without other direct benefits to actor-parent

NAME: Parental solliciation by young
DEFINITION: Signals or postures by offspring to secure attention of parent(s)

NAME: Protection of offspring
DEFINITION: Guarding and defense of young

NAME: Creching behavior
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with pooling of multiple unrelated offspring by their different parents

NAME: Mouth-brooding post-hatch
DEFINITION: Behavior of taking recently-hatched fry into mouth of parent in response to danger (in mouth-brooding organisms)

NAME: Nest relocation behavior
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with establishing a new alternate nest site, including transport of young by parents to a new site

NAME: Parasiticide provision
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with bringing to a nest or offspring, plants or other agents from the local environment that kill or in other ways inhibit parasites in offspring

NAME: Retrieval
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with returning offspring to a preferred site such as a nest or nearer the parent

NAME: Weaning behavior
DEFINITION: Behavior that restricts access to or reduces demand by offspring for provisioning by parent

NAME: Postcopulatory behavior
DEFINITION: Behavior such as self-hygiene or display following a copulation

NAME: Mate guarding
DEFINITION: Behavior of one member of a recently mating pair, associated with preventing its mate from engaging in subsequent matings with other individuals than the current mate

NAME: Mouth brooding
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with the retaining developing eggs or young in the mouth cavity

NAME: Pair affirmation
DEFINITION: Displays or other behaviors performed by pairs in longer term pair bonds to advertise relationship to each other and to other animals nearby

NAME: Rejection
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with refusing courtship or solicitation behaviors by avoidance, retreat, or other active repulsion of suitor.

NAME: Sexual harassment
DEFINITION: Any of several behaviors directed towards one animal unwilling to mate by another attempting to do so

NAME: Signal exchange
DEFINITION: Behavior that has evolved to convey information from one individual to another, whether or not it serves other functions as well; communication

NAME: Emission of a signal
DEFINITION: Behavior of sender in a communicative interaction

NAME: Reception of a signal
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with attempting to receive or receiving a signal from another

NAME: Social integration
DEFINITION: Behavior related to social interactions among animals outside of reproduction, conflict, and resource acquisition

NAME: Aiding
DEFINITION: Behavior that provides direct help or assistance to another

NAME: Allohygiene behavior
DEFINITION: Behavior by one animal to another than contributes to cleaning, parasite removal, surface covering adjustment, addition of conditioners to body surface, or other hygienic benefits to the receiver.

NAME: Bonding
DEFINITION: Behavior that establishes, advertises or maintains a positive, individual relationship to another animal

NAME: Conflict interference
DEFINITION: Behavior exhibited by a third party not currently involved in an agonistic interaction that limits the abilities of others to continue the interaction.

NAME: Greeting behavior
DEFINITION: Behaviors used to acknowledge the presence of one animal or group by another animal or group

NAME: Group activation-modulation behavior
DEFINITION: Behavior that indicates intention of one or more members of a social aggregation to change activity states

NAME: Movement coordination behavior
DEFINITION: Behavior that facilitates functionally synchronized movements by multiple animals

NAME: Norm maintenance
DEFINITION: Behavior that reflects an animal's discomfort about the violation of some accepted norm or precept governing their social interactions. Includes behaviors such as punishment that stem from violation of some accepted social rule

NAME: Reassurance
DEFINITION: Behavior that serves to restore to prior condition another animal's state after a conflict or frightening stimulus

NAME: Reconciliation
DEFINITION: Behavior that facilitates the restoration of normal interactions between parties that recently engaged in a conflict

NAME: Recruitment
DEFINITION: Behavior that serves to invite other animals to join a group

NAME: Self-declaration behavior
DEFINITION: A signal or posture that broadcasts presence and often identity of signaler

NAME: Age declaration
DEFINITION: A signal or posture that reveal the age of the actor

NAME: Arrival-departure declaration
DEFINITION: Behavior that mediates the process of joining a group or leaving one

NAME: Bond status declaration
DEFINITION: Signal or behavior that reveals to receivers the state of the individual's social relationship with another

NAME: Dominance status declaration
DEFINITION: Signal or behavior that reveals the social dominance status of the individual

NAME: Group membership declaration
DEFINITION: Signal or behavior that reveals that the signaller is belongs to a social group

NAME: Identity declaration
DEFINITION: Signal or behavior that reveals individual indentity

NAME: Location declaration
DEFINITION: Signal or behavior that reveals signaller's current location

NAME: Reproductive condition declaration
DEFINITION: Signal or behavior that reveals signaller's current reproductive condition

NAME: Sex declaration
DEFINITION: Signal or behavior that reveals signaller's sex

NAME: Territorial status declaration
DEFINITION: Signal or behavior that reveals whether or not the signaller holds a territory

NAME: Solicitation-invitation
DEFINITION: Behavior that indicates approval or acceptance by one animal of another animal beginning some new activity or state

NAME: Feeding solicitation
DEFINITION: Behavior by one animal that signals that it wants to be fed, or by one animal offering to feed or share food

NAME: Grooming-preening solicitation
DEFINITION: Behavior that invites or signals another to groom or be groomed

NAME: Joining solliciation
DEFINITION: Behavior that invites one or more other individuals to act as a group or to allow signaller to become part of a group

NAME: Protection solicitation
DEFINITION: Behavior inviting another to be protected or to provide protection

NAME: Thermoregulation solicitation
DEFINITION: Behavior inviting another to provide or receive thermoregulatory assistance

NAME: Transport solicitation
DEFINITION: Behavior offering to transport others or requesting such transportation

NAME: Spatial adjustment
DEFINITION: Behavior that adjusts relative proximity within a group of animals or between groups of animals

NAME: Approach
DEFINITION: The directed movement of one animal towards another, thereby decreasing distance between them

NAME: Withdraw
DEFINITION: The directed movement of one animal away from another, thereby increasing distance between them

NAME: Territoriality
DEFINITION: Behavior occurring in the context of animals attempting to maintain or gain control over a spatial area.

NAME: Intruder advertisement behavior
DEFINITION: Behavior of a non-resident intruder that signals its presence in another's territory

NAME: Intrusion alarm behavior
DEFINITION: Signal given by territorial residents upon discovery of an intruder

NAME: Owner advertisement behavior
DEFINITION: Behavior of territory resident that signals its presence, including occupying a location where its presence is easily detected and marking of boundaries

NAME: Patrolling behavior
DEFINITION: Regular visits by territorial resident of multiple points within the area or along the perimeter of their territory

NAME: Tool preparation
DEFINITION: The modification of object for use to facilitate acquisition of food or other task

NAME: Body part movement
DEFINITION: A change of place or position of part of an organism that does not involve the entire organism

NAME: Inflate body part
DEFINITION: To enlarge a body part by filling it with air or fluid

NAME: Move head
DEFINITION: A change in place or position of the portion of the organism containing the brain, mouth and main sense organs.

NAME: Nod head
DEFINITION: The act of moving the head up and down at the neck.

NAME: Rotate head
DEFINITION: The act of moving the head in a plane, circularly, pivoting at the neck.

NAME: Shake head
DEFINITION: The act of rapidly moving the head back and forth in any direction.

NAME: Move limb or appendage
DEFINITION: The act of changing the place or position of a body part that projects from the body

NAME: Autotomize
DEFINITION: Behavior facilitating the self-amputation of a body part (usually legs or tails) when threatened, attacked, or damaged

NAME: Extend
DEFINITION: The act of stretching limb or appendage out to its full length away from the body

NAME: Kick-punch
DEFINITION: The act of moving a limb or appendage quickly or forcefully

NAME: Retract
DEFINITION: The act of drawing or pulling back limb or appendage toward the body

NAME: Wave-wiggle
DEFINITION: The act of moving back and forth quickly

NAME: Move mouth parts
DEFINITION: The act of moving any of the tissues and hard structures surrounding the orifice that intakes food

NAME: Bite
DEFINITION: The act of seizing with teeth or jaws an object or organism so as to grip or break the surface covering

NAME: Filter Feed
DEFINITION: The act of straining suspended matter and food particles from water, typically by passing the water over a specialized filtering structure

NAME: Gnaw-chew
DEFINITION: The act of repeated grinding, tearing, and or crushing with teeth or jaws

NAME: Other moved mouth parts
DEFINITION: The act of moving any of the tissues and hard structures surrounding the mouth other than teeth, jaws or filter structures

NAME: Rasp
DEFINITION: The act of scraping or cutting done with a radula

NAME: Spit
DEFINITION: The act of forcefully expelling liquid with or without saliva from the mouth

NAME: Suck
DEFINITION: The act of producing a partial vacuum in the mouth by contracting the muscles of the lips, cheeks, or tongue; may or may not include the subsequent intake of substances into the mouth

NAME: Swallow
DEFINITION: The act of moving food from the mouth cavity to the esophagus through coordinated muscular movements.

NAME: Tongue movement
DEFINITION: The act of displacing part or all of the tongue from its current position

NAME: Lick
DEFINITION: The act of stroking or touching with the tongue

NAME: Other moved body part
DEFINITION: The act of changing place or position of a body part that is not the head, mouth parts, or limbs

NAME: Color Change
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with a relatively immediate change in the wavelengths of light reflected by the animal's skin or feather

NAME: Change Skin Color
DEFINITION: A relatively immediate change in visible light reflectance of the dermis that is under either neurological or hormonal control

NAME: Expose or highlight color patch
DEFINITION: The act of moving body part(s) or making postural adjustment that brings a patch of color into the view of an observer

NAME: Excrete
DEFINITION: The act of eliminating waste products from the body

NAME: Defecate
DEFINITION: The act of expelling wastes from lower digestive tract, usually through anal opening

NAME: Urinate
DEFINITION: The act of expelling nitrogenous waste products collected by urinary organs

NAME: Vomit
DEFINITION: The act of forcibly ejecting the contents of the digestive tract through the mouth

NAME: Group Actions
DEFINITION: Behaviors that are described for or done by groups of animals, not individual animals

NAME: Act in concert
DEFINITION: Coordinated or joint movement or action by two or more individuals

NAME: Huddle
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with two or more individuals' achieving or maintaining close and extensive bodily contact; to nestle closely with another

NAME: Join-Aggregate
DEFINITION: The act of coalescing spatially as a group

NAME: Separate-Disperse
DEFINITION: Actions of group members in concert as they increase the distance between individuals or spread out over a larger area.

NAME: Life History Transitions
DEFINITION: Change from one lifestage to another characterized by developmental milestones

NAME: Die
DEFINITION: The permanent cessation of all vital bodily processes

NAME: Give Birth
DEFINITION: Emergence of live young from gestating parent

NAME: Hatching-Birth
DEFINITION: The event in the life of an individual in which it emerges from either an egg or a gestating parent.

NAME: Metamorphose
DEFINITION: A change in an individual organism or its parts during which it develops from an immature to an adult that results in complete alteration of their forms and habits

NAME: Moult
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with shedding the skin, cuticle, hair, or feathers

NAME: Locomotion
DEFINITION: Movement of entire body from one location to another, without contacting objects or other individuals

NAME: Arrest Motion
DEFINITION: Transition from locomotory phase to static phase

NAME: Brake
DEFINITION: Behavior by a moving animal that relatively quickly decreases its speed or stops it

NAME: Movement on a substrate
DEFINITION: Movement through one medium by achieving traction on another

NAME: Climb
DEFINITION: Vertical movement using limbs or body to adhere to the substrate

NAME: Crawl-slither
DEFINITION: The act of moving with the body close to or touching the substrate, with or without the use of limbs

NAME: Jump-hop
DEFINITION: The act of propelling upward by a sudden burst of power from the limbs

NAME: Run
DEFINITION: The act of locomoting on limbs with body off the ground such that periodically none of the limbs are touching the ground

NAME: Walk
DEFINITION: The act of locomoting on limbs with body off the ground such that at least one limb is always touching the ground

NAME: Movement through substrate-medium
DEFINITION: Movement through a medium without using another medium or substrate for traction

NAME: Burrow
DEFINITION: The act of moving through solids by boring through them or by displacing portions of them

NAME: Dive
DEFINITION: To descend or fall precipitously, leading with the head

NAME: Float
DEFINITION: To be bouyed up by a medium, without controlled horizontal movement

NAME: Fly
DEFINITION: The act of moving through the air using wings

NAME: Glide
DEFINITION: The act of moving through the air without propulsion

NAME: Jet
DEFINITION: the act of propulsion by means of any fluid that is forced out in a stream in the opposite direction

NAME: Swim
DEFINITION: The act of moving through water propelled by limbs, appendages or body

NAME: Startup
DEFINITION: The act of changing from static phase to locomotory phase

NAME: Make contact with or receive contact
DEFINITION: Any behavior involving direct physical contact with another individual or object

NAME: Bathe
DEFINITION: The act of making contact with a material that serves to clean or remove undesired matter from the surface

NAME: Build
DEFINITION: To act of manipulating object(s) or material resulting in the construction of a new object or modifications to an existing one

NAME: Collide
DEFINITION: The act of forcefully contacting or suddenly bumping into object or organism(s) with whole body

NAME: Constrict
DEFINITION: The act of tightening or narrowing by applying encircling pressure

NAME: Excavate
DEFINITION: The act of making a hole in an object or substance, by removing material, e.g., by scooping or digging

NAME: Grasp
DEFINITION: The act of seizing and holding firmly with some part of the body

NAME: Groom
DEFINITION: The act of using body parts to pick at, rub and or remove material from exterior covering, e.g., fur, scales, feathers, skin

NAME: Head butt
DEFINITION: The act of driving the head into another organism or object

NAME: Hit
DEFINITION: The act of bringing a limb or appendage rapidly and forcefully into contact with another individual or object

NAME: Hold
DEFINITION: The act of supporting object or organism with some part of body

NAME: Hug
DEFINITION: The act of encircling with the limbs

NAME: Move
DEFINITION: The act of transporting object or organism from one location to another

NAME: Pick
DEFINITION: The act of grasping and pulling at something with either fingers or mouth

NAME: Rub
DEFINITION: The act of repeatedly moving a body part over a surface, object, or portion of body, or backwards and forwards upon it, with a certain amount of pressure and friction

NAME: Scratch
DEFINITION: The act of dragging claws or nails over a surface

NAME: Sting
DEFINITION: The act of piercing with a specialized part of the body, sometimes injecting venom

NAME: Stroke
DEFINITION: The act of passing a hand, limb or appendage softly in one direction over an organism, surface, or object

NAME: Touch
DEFINITION: The act of putting some other part of the body, upon, or into contact with something

NAME: Wrestle-grapple
DEFINITION: The act of struggling against an opponent using limbs and body strength to hold or move them

NAME: Other whole body movement
DEFINITION: The act of changing position of the entire body that does not move the organism from one location to another

NAME: Rotate
DEFINITION: The act of turning the body so that the animal is facing a different direction, but still in the same location

NAME: Shake
DEFINITION: The act of vibrating whole body; also includes quivering or trembling

NAME: Sit down or lower body
DEFINITION: The act of moving the body core lower, closer to the ground

NAME: Stand up or raise body
DEFINITION: The act of movine the body core higher, away from the ground

NAME: Tilt
DEFINITION: The act of moving the whole body in one direction while still remaining in place at the same point on the substrate

NAME: Writhe
DEFINITION: The act of repeatedly contorting or twisting whole body

NAME: Produce electric field
DEFINITION: Behavior associated causally with producing a significant electric current in the surrounding environment.

NAME: Produce light
DEFINITION: Behavior associated causally with producing electromagnetic radiation of wavelengths that fall in the visible light spectrum

NAME: Produce sound
DEFINITION: Behavior associated causally with producing vibrations that travel through a medium and are perceptible by auditory organs

NAME: Burp
DEFINITION: Behavior associated causally with producing sound through the expulsion of gas from the gut vibrating the esophagus

NAME: Cavitate
DEFINITION: Behavior associated causally with producing sound via the expulsion of air in a liquid

NAME: Clap
DEFINITION: Behavior associated causally with producing sound by rapidly striking two body parts together

NAME: Drum-strum
DEFINITION: Behavior associated causally with producing sound by repeatedly striking an inanimate object or body.

NAME: Hiss
DEFINITION: Behavior associated causally with producing sound by a rapid and forceful release of air

NAME: Non-vocal hum
DEFINITION: Behavior associated causally with producing a low constant vibration without use of membranes in a respiratory tract

NAME: Rattle
DEFINITION: Behavior associated causally with producing sound by shaking a hollow body part or object filled with small solid objects

NAME: Stridulate
DEFINITION: Behavior associated causally with producing sound by rubbing one part of its body surface against another

NAME: Vocalize
DEFINITION: Behavior associated causally with producing sound by vibrating membranes in the respiratory tract

NAME: Whistle
DEFINITION: Behavior associated causally with producing sound from the vibration of a constant air stream from the mouth

NAME: Reproductive or Sexual Acts
DEFINITION: Behavior involving the reproductive organs, the genitals, the release of gametes, or aiding the production of offspring

NAME: Copulate
DEFINITION: Male's insertion of sperm-transfer organ into the body of the female

NAME: Deposit spermatophore
DEFINITION: The act of placing a body of sperm and associated materials (spermatophore) either on the substrate or in the body of a female

NAME: Falsely copulate
DEFINITION: Act of heterosexual or homosexual mounting with, or without intromission, that is not used for inseminative purposes

NAME: Incubate
DEFINITION: Act of an individual's maintaining a position so that its body heat warms its eggs sufficiently for embryonic development to proceed

NAME: Masturbate
DEFINITION: The act of self-stimulating the genitals

NAME: Mount-Amplex
DEFINITION: The act of clasping or positioning between male and female to facilitate copulation or ensure close proximity of released gametes,  with or without intromission

NAME: Oviposit
DEFINITION: The act of depositing eggs either into a medium, or onto a substrate

NAME: Release gametes or zygotes
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with the ejection of haploid cells or single-cell diploid bodies into a medium or onto a substrate

NAME: Secrete
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with and resulting in the production and subsequent release of any substance or product elaborated, and released by a cell or gland

NAME: Ink Release
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with and resulting in release of pigmented fluid

NAME: Lactate
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with and resulting in the secretion of milk from mammary glands and its release or removal from the body

NAME: Produce silk
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with and resulting in the secretion of protein fibers

NAME: Produce slime
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with and resulting in the secretion of a mucous-containing substance

NAME: Produce wax
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with and resulting in the secretion of non-fatty lipid substance

NAME: Regurgitate
DEFINITION: The act of ejecting previously ingested material through the oral opening

NAME: Salivate
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with and resulting in thesecretion of fluid containing digestive enzymes into the oral cavity

NAME: Scent mark-release pheromone
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with and resulting in the secretion of a substance designed to produce a specific behavioral or physiological response in another individual.

NAME: Tear Release
DEFINITION: Behavior associated with and resulting in the secretion of fluid from the lachrymal glands

NAME: Static Pose
DEFINITION: Act of maintaining a state of relative immobility, not locomoting or changing the position of body parts

NAME: Hang
DEFINITION: Act of taking or maintaining a stationary position in which the animal is supported by its attachment to the substrate above it

NAME: Lie
DEFINITION: Act of taking or maintaining a stationary position with weight centered along the length of the animal

NAME: Sit
DEFINITION: Act of taking or maintaining a body position of legged animals in which weight is centered on some part of the rear body, but the legs or feet are still engaged with the substrate

NAME: Stand
DEFINITION: Act of taking or maintaining a stationary position with weight centered on limbs and body not touching the substrate
